original: In more recent practice, between the announcement of the nomination and the start of hearings, the Judiciary Committee undertakes an investigative stage in which committee members and their staffs prepare for the hearings by looking over the background of the nominees and relevant issues.
simplified: More recently, after a nominee is announced, the Judiciary Committee does some investigation before the hearings start. || During this time, committee members and their staffs get ready for the hearings by looking into the nominee's background and relevant issues.

original: In more recent practice, between the announcement of the nomination and the start of hearings, the Judiciary Committee undertakes an investigative stage in which committee members and their staffs prepare for the hearings by looking over the background of the nominees and relevant issues.
simplified: In more recent practice, between the announcement of the nomination and the start of hearings, the Judiciary Committee and its staffs prepare for the hearings by looking over the background of the nominees and the issues that will be discussed in the hearings.

original: In more recent practice, between the announcement of the nomination and the start of hearings, the Judiciary Committee undertakes an investigative stage in which committee members and their staffs prepare for the hearings by looking over the background of the nominees and relevant issues.
simplified: When the hearings start after nominations, the Judiciary Committee members and their staff look at the background of nominees.

original: Described as a darkly comedic bio-pic, Emilia Jones was confirmed to be portraying the whistle-blower Reality Winner from a script written by Kerry Howley based on her own 2017 New York Magazine feature, "Who Is Reality Winner?" with Fogel also on board to direct.
simplified: Emilia Jones will portray Reality Winner, the whistle-blower, in a dark comedy bio-pic. || Kerry Howley wrote the script, which is based on her own 2017 New York Magazine feature, "Who Is Reality Winner?" || Fogel will also direct the movie.

original: Whereas earlier major protests, which were violently quelled by Iran's government, focused on election results or economic woes, the current protest, besides increased rights for women, has one main demand: the overthrow of the Islamic Republic.
simplified: Earlier major protests focused on election results or economic problems and were violently stopped by Iran’s government. || In addition to increasing women’s rights, the current protest has one main demand: the overthrow of the Islamic Republic.

simplified: Earlier major protests, which were violently quelled by Iran's government, focused on election results or economic problems. || The current protest, however, has one main demand: that the Islamic Republic be removed from power.

original: An activist hiding his identity said the Egyptian authorities were carrying out random detentions ahead of COP, where they are randomly stopping people and inspecting their mobile phones to look for any evidence of dissent.
simplified: An activist who did not want to be named said the Egyptian government was holding random arrests ahead of COP. || He said they stopped people at random and checked their phones to look for evidence of dissent.

original: An activist hiding his identity said the Egyptian authorities were carrying out random detentions ahead of COP, where they are randomly stopping people and inspecting their mobile phones to look for any evidence of dissent.
simplified: An activist hiding his identity said Egyptian authorities were randomly interrogating people ahead of COP, such as randomly stopping people and inspecting their phones for dissent.

original: An activist hiding his identity said the Egyptian authorities were carrying out random detentions ahead of COP, where they are randomly stopping people and inspecting their mobile phones to look for any evidence of dissent.
simplified: An activist said the Egyptian government was doing random phone searches ahead of a climate change conference. || During the search, they were looking for any evidence of dispute with the government.

original: An activist hiding his identity said the Egyptian authorities were carrying out random detentions ahead of COP, where they are randomly stopping people and inspecting their mobile phones to look for any evidence of dissent.
simplified: An activist who did not want to reveal his name said the Egyptian authorities were arresting people without a reason before COP, where they stop people randomly and look at their cell phones for any proof of disagreement.
comment: Debated between elaboration and "the same meaning" for the substitution of "hiding his identity" and "who did not want to reveal his name," ultimately went with the same meaning.

original: An activist hiding his identity said the Egyptian authorities were carrying out random detentions ahead of COP, where they are randomly stopping people and inspecting their mobile phones to look for any evidence of dissent.
simplified: An activist who wants to stay anonymous said that the Egyptian authorities are arresting people without a reason before COP. || They are stopping people and checking their phones for anything that shows they disagree with the government.
